red_flag_combinations.message: Fever with a stiff neck and bad headache could be a sign of meningitis. This is an emergency.
Fever with confusion or change in thinking needs immediate attention. This could be a sign of a serious infection.
Fever with a quickly spreading rash or tiny purple dots that don't fade when pressed may be a sign of a dangerous infection.
A temperature over 104°F (40°C) is very high and needs urgent medical care.
Fever in someone with a weakened immune system can be very dangerous and needs to be seen right away.
Uncontrollable shaking chills with confusion may be a sign of a severe bloodstream infection (sepsis).
Fever with severe difficulty swallowing could be a throat infection that needs urgent evaluation.
Fever with coughing up blood needs immediate medical evaluation.
A long-lasting fever after travel to a tropical area could be a sign of a travel-related illness like malaria. This needs special testing.
High fever with a single red, swollen, painful joint could be a joint infection (septic arthritis). This is an emergency that needs immediate treatment.
Any fever in someone with a weakened immune system can be dangerous. Even a low fever needs to be checked right away.
